intro: Tyloglossa adenostachya, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often with a rosette-like arrangement of leaves. Its flowers are usually violet or purple in color, and they bloom in clusters at the top of the stems. Tyloglossa adenostachya is popular as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
